 ImageWidget (gaia::core::Context *context, bool extension=false)

Detailed Description

Displays an arbitrary image, such as an icon.

The ImageWidget class can load images from various sources (such as resources or content providers), takes care of computing its measurement from the image so that it can be used in any layout manager, and provides various display options such as scaling and tinting.

 // Set image widget click event
 #include <gaia/core/event/OnClickListener.h>
 class MyOnClickListener : public gaia::core::OnClickListener 
 {
     public:
         MyOnClickListener(gaia::core::Page* page) {};
         ~MyOnClickListener() {};
         virtual void onClick(gaia::core::Widget* v) {};
 };
 MyOnClickListener listener(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 ImageWidget* iv = new ImageWidget(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 iv->setOnClickListener(&listener);

 ImageWidget* iv = new ImageWidget(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 // set image from reource
 iv->setImageResource(R::drawable::image1);
 // set image max height
 iv->setMaxHeight(70);
 // set image max width
 iv->setMaxWidth(70);
 iv->setAdjustViewBounds(true);
 //move widget to end
 iv->setScaleType(ImageWidget::FIT_END);

Definition at line 60 of file ImageWidget.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::ui::ImageWidget::ScaleType

Options for scaling the bounds of an image to the bounds of this view.

Enumerator:
MATRIX 

Scale using the image matrix when drawing.

The image matrix can be set using setImageMatrix(const graphics::Matrix*). From XML, use this syntax:

FIT_XY 

Scale the image using graphics::Matrix::ScaleToFit#FILL.

FIT_START 

Scale the image using graphics::Matrix::ScaleToFit#START.

FIT_CENTER 

Scale the image using graphics::Matrix::ScaleToFit#CENTER.

FIT_END 

Scale the image using graphics::Matrix::ScaleToFit#END.

CENTER 

Center the image in the view, but perform no scaling.

CENTER_CROP 

Scale the image uniformly (maintain the image's aspect ratio) so that both dimensions (width and height) of the image will be equal to or larger than the corresponding dimension of the view (minus padding).

The image is then centered in the view.

CENTER_INSIDE 

Scale the image uniformly (maintain the image's aspect ratio) so that both dimensions (width and height) of the image will be equal to or less than the corresponding dimension of the view (minus padding).

The image is then centered in the view.

graphics::Drawer* gaia::ui::ImageWidget::getDrawer ( )

Return the view's drawer, or null if no drawer has been assigned.

graphics::Matrix gaia::ui::ImageWidget::getImageMatrix ( )

Return the view's optional matrix.

This is applied to the view's drawer when it is drawn. If there is not matrix, this method will return null. Do not change this matrix in place. If you want a different matrix applied to the drawer, be sure to call setImageMatrix().

ScaleType gaia::ui::ImageWidget::getScaleType ( )

Return the current scale type in use by this ImageWidget.

void gaia::ui::ImageWidget::setBaselineAlignBottom ( bool  aligned)

Set whether to set the baseline of this view to the bottom of the view.

Setting this value overrides any calls to setBaseline.

Parameters:
alignedIf true, the image view will be baseline aligned with based on its bottom edge.

void gaia::ui::ImageWidget::setImageResource ( int32_t  resId)

Sets a drawer as the content of this ImageWidget.

This does Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause a latency hiccup. If that's a concern, consider using setImageDrawer or setImageBitmap and graphics::BitmapFactory instead.

Parameters:
resIdthe resource identifier of the the drawer
void gaia::ui::ImageWidget::setImageState ( )

Sets image state.

void gaia::ui::ImageWidget::setMaxHeight ( int32_t  maxHeight)

An optional argument to supply a maximum height for this view.

Only valid if setAdjustViewBounds has been set to true. To set an image to be a maximum of 100 x 100 while preserving the original aspect ratio, do the following: 1) set adjustViewBounds to true 2) set maxWidth and maxHeight to 100 3) set the height and width layout params to WRAP_CONTENT.

Note that this view could be still smaller than 100 x 100 using this approach if the original image is small. To set an image to a fixed size, specify that size in the layout params and then use setScaleType to determine how to fit the image within the bounds.

Parameters:
maxHeightmaximum height for this view
void gaia::ui::ImageWidget::setMaxWidth ( int32_t  maxWidth)

An optional argument to supply a maximum width for this view.

Only valid if setAdjustViewBounds has been set to true. To set an image to be a maximum of 100 x 100 while preserving the original aspect ratio, do the following: 1) set adjustViewBounds to true 2) set maxWidth and maxHeight to 100 3) set the height and width layout params to WRAP_CONTENT.

Note that this view could be still smaller than 100 x 100 using this approach if the original image is small. To set an image to a fixed size, specify that size in the layout params and then use setScaleType to determine how to fit the image within the bounds.

Parameters:
maxWidthmaximum width for this view
void gaia::ui::ImageWidget::setScaleType ( const ScaleType  scaleType)

Controls how the image should be resized or moved to match the size of this ImageWidget.

Parameters:
scaleTypeThe desired scaling mode.
